docs.snippet: BEACH--Arthur T. Arthur died peacefully at home on October 3rd at the age of 92. He was born on December 2, 1920 in Brooklyn and lived his entire life in Huntington. Artie graduated from Stony Brook Prep School and Lafayette College, class of 1942...
docs.lead_paragraph: BEACH--Arthur T. Arthur died peacefully at home on October 3rd at the age of 92. He was born on December 2, 1920 in Brooklyn and lived his entire life in Huntington. Artie graduated from Stony Brook Prep School and Lafayette College, class of 1942, with a degree in mechanical engineering. He played football for the Leopards and was a member of Phi Delta Theta. He served as an artillery officer in the Pacific Theatre from 1942-1946 in WWII. He was Chairman of the Board of Beach Russ Company, Abbe Engineering, and a member of the American Vacuum Society. Artie held several patents in vacuum engineering. He was also a long-time member of Huntington Country Club where he excelled at tennis and paddle tennis. With his sons earning three national championship trophies, Artie was a lifelong lacrosse fan. He had a magnetic personality and keen sense of humor. Artie had a wonderful life full of family fun, good times and great friends. He is survived by five children and their in-laws: Rick and Cade of Maplewood, NJ; Betsy and Monk of Rye, NY; Liz of Cold Spring Harbor, NY; Cyndy and Mark of Pasadena, MD; Todd of Huntington, NY; Peter and Lisa of Huntington, NY; fourteen grandchildren and two great- grandchildren. He is predeceased by his beautiful wife of 60 years, Kiki, and his beloved son, CA. Contributions may be made in Artie's memory to the US Lacrosse Foundation, 113 West University Parkway, Baltimore, MD 21210. A memorial service will be held at the Old First Church in Huntington, NY on Thursday, October 17th at 11am.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BEACH, ARTHUR T
